title: Parallel Structure Quiz
description: Good writing uses parallel structure for clarity and rhythm. Can you spot and fix parallelism errors?

questions.question: Which sentence uses parallel structure correctly?
options: She likes hiking, swimming, and to ride bikes.
She likes to hike, swimming, and riding bikes.
She likes hiking, swimming, and riding bikes.
She likes hiking, to swim, and bike riding.

questions.question: What is parallel structure?
options: Repeating the same word for emphasis
Using the same grammatical form for similar ideas in a series
Using the same sentence length throughout
Writing two paragraphs with the same topic

questions.question: Which sentence has a parallelism error?
options: Both A and B are correct.
The coach told them to stretch, to run, and to cool down.
The coach told them to stretch, running, and cooling down.
The coach told them to stretch, run, and cool down.

questions.question: Fix the parallelism: 'He is smart, funny, and has ambition.'
options: He has smart, funny, and ambition.
He is smart, funny, and ambition.
He is smartly, funnily, and ambitiously.
He is smart, funny, and ambitious.

questions.question: Which sentence is parallel?
options: I came, I saw, I conquered.
I came, I was seeing, and conquering.
I came, seeing, and conquered.
Coming, I saw, and I conquered.

questions.question: Which list is parallel? 'For dinner, we had ___.'
options: a salad, chicken that was grilled, and lemonade to drink
salad, to grill chicken, and drinking lemonade
salad, grilled chicken, and we drank lemonade
salad, grilled chicken, and lemonade

questions.question: Fix: 'The project requires research, writing, and to present findings.'
options: The project requires research, writing, and presenting findings.
The project requires researching, to write, and presenting.
The project requires to research, writing, and presenting.
The project requires research, to write, and present.

questions.question: Which sentence demonstrates parallel structure with correlative conjunctions?
options: She not only singing but also dances.
She not only sings but also is dancing.
She not only sings but also dances.
Not only she sings but she also dances.

questions.question: Which is parallel? 'He likes either ___ or ___.'
options: reading / watching movies
reading / to watch movies
to read / watching movies
to read / movie watching

questions.question: Fix the error: 'The teacher asked students to study hard, arrive on time, and that they should participate.'
options: ...study hard, to arrive on time, and participating.
...studying hard, arriving on time, and that they participate.
...to study hard, to arrive on time, and they should participate.
...to study hard, arrive on time, and participate.

questions.question: Which sentence is NOT parallel?
options: She is kind, generous, and thinks of others.
She is kind, generous, and thoughtful.
She is kind, generous, and compassionate.
She is kind, generous, and caring.

questions.question: Why is parallel structure important in writing?
options: It eliminates the need for punctuation.
It is only important in poetry.
It improves clarity, rhythm, and readability.
It makes sentences shorter.

questions.question: Which famous quote uses parallel structure? 'Ask not what your country can do for you â€” ask what you can do for your country.'
options: Winston Churchill
John F. Kennedy
Abraham Lincoln
Theodore Roosevelt

questions.question: Fix: 'The best things in life are laughing with friends, good food, and to travel.'
options: ...to laugh with friends, good food, and traveling.
...laughing with friends, eating good food, and traveling.
...laugh with friends, good food, and travel.
...laughing, food, and to travel.

questions.question: Which sentence pairs items in parallel form?
options: The old house was drafty, leaking, and it needed paint.
The old house drafts, leaks, and needing paint.
The old house was drafty, leaky, and shabby.
The old house was drafty, leaky, and needed painting.
